alert.note: Alert for Gloucester; Mathews; Middlesex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 4:10PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Gloucester, southeastern Middlesex and Mathews Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 409 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hayes, or near Gloucester Courthouse, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Achilles around 415 PM EDT. Gloucester Courthouse and Hayes around 420 PM EDT. Mobjack around 440 PM EDT. Mathews and Blakes around 450 PM EDT. Deltaville and Gwynn around 500 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Ruff, Beulah, Moon, Laban, Glass, Naxera, Harmony Village, Grafton, Harcum and Cash. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
